preloader.requirements-failed.title: System Warning
preloader.requirements-failed.no-compute: Your GPU ('<gpu-name/>') does not support compute shaders. Please ensure your system meets the minimum system requirements. You can also try updating your Graphics Drivers.
preloader.requirements-failed.not-enough: Your GPU ('<gpu-name/>') does not have enough VRAM (<gpu-vram/> MB). <required-vram/> MB VRAM is required at least. Please ensure your system meets the minimum system requirements.
Your System does not have enough memory (<memory/> MB). <required-memory/> MB Memory is required at least. Please ensure your system meets the minimum system requirements.
preloader.requirements-failed.bad-os-win: Your operating system version (<os-version/>) is not supported. Please ensure your system meets the minimum system requirements (Windows <minimum-os-version/> or newer).

preload.graphic-quality.low-end-gpu-warn: Integrated/Low End GPU () is being used. Using Presets other than 'Minimum' might crash the game.
preload.telemetry.title: Privacy
preload.telemetry.description:
To improve the game, we would like to collect anonymized statistics and data about balancing, playtime, level completion time, crashes, performance & system statistics, settings, and achievements. 

This also involves using a third-party service called "Unity Analytics".

All data is sent anonymously and cannot be traced back to you.

If you are interested in the details, you can also check our <link:privacy-policy>Privacy Policy</link>.
preload.changelog.description: Here are the changes since you last played - You can also view them at any time in the Main Menu using About - Changelog.

preload.dev-warning.warning-0: Sharing screenshots/videos outside the Shapez 2 Discord is NOT permitted.
preload.dev-warning.warning-1: Bugs, issues & feedback should be reported in the Shapez 2 Discord.

menu.modeconfig.title: Customize Mode
menu.modeconfig.seed.description: The same seed in combination with the same map generation options will always generate exactly the same map, which means you can also share it with others.
menu.modeconfig.research-multiplier.desc: Controls the amount of shapes you need to deliver to complete milestones / side tasks.
menu.modeconfig.chunk-limit-multiplier.d: There is a limit to the amount of platforms you can build, which can be increased by research. You can adjust the limit increase here, and also disable the limit entirely.
menu.modeconfig.blueprint-cost-multiplie: Copy/pasting costs blueprint points, which you gain by delivering specific shapes. Control the amount of blueprint points required here. You can also disable the cost entirely.
menu.modeconfig.difficulty-preset.descri: Controls the amount of shapes required, costs of Copy/Paste and how many platforms you can build.
menu.modeconfig.difficulty-preset.hint-r: Tip: You can change the difficulty preset at any time.
menu.modeconfig.difficulty-preset.hint-p: Please make sure to acquire your <gl>Operators Certificate</gl> first.
menu.modeconfig.scenario-preset.descript: Determines the progression of the game, which shapes are required & generated on the map and much more.
menu.modeconfig.mapgen.preview.toggle-vi: You can disable the preview to avoid spoiling yourself.
menu.modeconfig.mapgen.fluids.spawn-prim: Whether primary colors (usually red, green, blue) are spawned on the map.
menu.modeconfig.mapgen.fluids.spawn-seco: Whether secondary mixed colors (usually yellow, magenta, cyan) are spawned on the map.
menu.modeconfig.mapgen.fluids.spawn-tert: Whether tertiary mixed colors (usually white) are spawned on the map.
menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shared.patch-like: Chance of a patch to spawn in a sector. A chance higher than 100% means that more than one patch can spawn, for example 120% means guaranteed one patch and 20% chance for a second.
menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shared.patch-base: The size of a patch in the same sector as the vortex.
menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shared.patch-size: How much % the patch grows with every sector distance to the vortex.
menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shared.patch-max-: The maximum size of a patch.
menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shapes.shape-colo: How likely it is that all parts of a shape are colored. Doesn't affect generally uncolored shapes.
menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shapes.rare-shape: How likely rare shapes (usually 'Stars') are spawned compared to common shapes.
menu.modeconfig.mapgen.shapes.very-rare-: How likely very rare shapes (usually 'Diamond') are spawned compared to common shapes.
menu.modeconfig.shapegen.title: Shape generation
menu.modeconfig.shapegen.likeliness.desc: The chance that a shape of this type will be selected when generating a patch.
menu.modeconfig.shapegen.min-distance-to: Minimum sector distance to the vortex from which this shape type can spawn.
menu.modeconfig.shapegen.examples.descri: Examples of shapes of this type that could spawn.

shape-viewer.title: Shape Viewer
shape-viewer.short-code.tooltip-descript: Every shape can be described via a unique code. For every part, there is an uppercase letter for the shape type and one for the color. Layers are separated by ':', and empty parts are indicated by '--'. Part Codes C: Circle R: Rectangle W: Diamond S: Star P: Pin (no color) c: Crystal Color Codes u: No color r: Red g: Green b: Blue c: Cyan m: Magenta y: Yellow w: White Examples CuCuCuCu: Uncolored circle RbRb----: Half blue rectangle

research.RNStackerLayer2.description: You were rewarded the <gl>Stacker</gl> and <gl>2nd Floor</gl>, allowing you to <gl>Stack Shapes</gl> and build <gl>Multi-Layer</gl> factories. Let's see what you can do with them!
research.RNBlueprints.title: Blueprints
research.RNBlueprints.description: We thought you might need this - You can now <gl>Copy</gl> and <gl>Paste</gl> parts of your factory. But not the messy ones, please!
research.RNIslandBuilding.title: Space Platforms
research.RNIslandBuilding.description:
You've proven some basic skills, so we think you are ready for this. You may now build <gl>Space Platforms</gl> and <gl>Foundations</gl> to expand in the universe.

For these ones though, we've added a <gl>Platform Limit</gl>. I mean, we are not insane, right?
research.RNFluids.title: Fluids & Painting
research.RNFluids.description:
Alright, let's break up with these boring gray shapes. You can now extract <gl>Fluids</gl> and <gl>Paint</gl> shapes. 

But do us a favor and don't spill anything on the floor, they stick really well.
research.RNTrains.title: Trains
research.RNTrains.description: We know you've been waiting for these. <gl>Huge Amounts</gl> of shapes over <gl>Long Distances</gl> - the dream of every operator!
research.RNPinPusher.title: Pin Pusher
research.RNPinPusher.description: <gl>Pushes</gl> a shape up and creates a <gl>Support Pin</gl> below every non-empty quadrant on the first layer.
research.RNColorMixing.title: Color Mixing
research.RNColorMixing.description: Let's have some more fun with colors! With the <gl>Color Mixer</gl> you can mix any two colors to create <gl>Secondary</gl> and <gl>Tertiary</gl> colors.
research.RNCrystals.title: Crystals
research.RNCrystals.description:
Alright, let's spice things up a bit with <gl>Crystals</gl>! Fill fluid into empty <gl>Gaps</gl> or <gl>Pins</gl> of a shape and harden it with the <gl>Crystal Generator</gl>.

We tried our best, but they still seem a little fragile - so better don't <gl>Cut</gl> through or <gl>Stack</gl> them.
research.RNEndOfGame.title: Final Qualification
research.RNEndOfGame.description: Congratulations, operator, you <gl>Passed</gl> the final qualification!
research.RNWireBasics.title: Wire Basics
research.RNWireBasics.description: Unlocks <gl>Wires</gl>, <gl>Signals</gl>, <gl>Filters</gl>, <gl>Readers</gl>, <gl>Displays</gl> and <gl>Buttons</gl> to automate your factory even more!
research.RNWireLogicGates.title: Logic Gates
research.RNWireLogicGates.description: Unlocks <gl>And</gl>, <gl>Or</gl>, <gl>Not</gl>, <gl>Xor</gl>, <gl>Transistors</gl> and the <gl>Comparator</gl> to perform boolean logic with signals.
research.RNWireVirtualProcessing.title: Simulated Buildings
research.RNWireVirtualProcessing.descrip: Allows you to <gl>Simulate</gl> the <gl>Cutting</gl>, <gl>Stacking</gl>, <gl>Unstacking</gl> and <gl>Painting</gl> of logical shape signals.
research.RNWireTransmission.title: Global Wire Transmission
research.RNWireTransmission.description: Unlocks the <gl>Global Wire Transmitters</gl>, allowing you to send signals wireless over different channels.
research.RNFluidMinerExtension.title: Fluid Miner Extensions
research.RNFluidMinerExtension.descripti: Allows you to connect <gl>Extensions</gl> to the <gl>Fluid Miner</gl> to increase its throughput.
research.RNTrainsGreen.title: Trains - Green
research.RNTrainsGreen.description: Allows you spawn <gl>Green</gl> trains & rails for more routing options.
research.RNTrainsBlue.title: Trains - Blue
research.RNTrainsBlue.description: Allows you spawn <gl>Blue</gl> trains & rails for more routing options.
research.RNTrainsWhite.title: Trains - White
research.RNTrainsWhite.description: Allows you spawn <gl>White</gl> trains & rails for more routing options.
research.RNTrainsFillerWagon.title: Trains - Filler Wagon
research.RNTrainsFillerWagon.description: Allows you build <gl>Filler Wagons</gl>, which can be used to space-out train wagons.
research.RNTrainsFluidWagons.title: Trains - Fluid Wagon
research.RNTrainsFluidWagons.description: Unlocks <gl>Fluid Wagons</gl>, allowing you to transport fluids via trains.
research.RNRailRollerCoasterDLCContent.d: Unlocks the purely cosmetic <gl>Rail Loop</gl> and <gl>Rail Twister</gl>.
research.RNFluidPacking.title: Fluid Packing
research.RNFluidPacking.description: Packages fluids, allowing them to be transported between space platforms as well as trains.
research.RNSandboxTools.title: Sandbox Tools
research.RNSandboxTools.description: Unlocks Sandbox Tools, allowing you to create any shape on the fly. This counts as cheating.
research.RNLayer3.title: 3rd Floor
research.RNLayer3.description: Unlocks the <gl>3rd Floor</gl>, allowing you to build on even more layers!
research.RNHubSize.title: More Vortex Inputs
research.RNHubSize.description: Increases the size of the Vortex to allow for more inputs.
research.RNIslandLayouts1.title: Foundations I
research.RNIslandLayouts2.title: Foundations II
research.RNIslandLayouts3.title: Foundations III
research.RNIslandLayouts4.title: Foundations IV

research.RULayer2.title: 2nd Floor
research.RULayer2.description: Unlocks the <gl>2nd Floor</gl>, enabling you to build multidimensional factories.
research.RULayer3.title: 3rd Floor
research.RULayer3.description: Unlocks the <gl>3rd Floor</gl>, enabling you to build even more compact factories.
research.RUBlueprints.title: Blueprints
research.RUBlueprints.description: Allows you to copy and paste parts of your factories.
research.RUIslandPlacement.title: Space Platforms
research.RUIslandPlacement.description: Allows you to expand into the space by placing new platforms.
research.RURailManagement.title: Trains
research.RURailManagement.description: Allows you to transport huge amounts of resources over long distances.
research.RUFluids.title: Fluids
research.RUFluids.description: Allows you to extract and transport fluids. Shapes can be painted with fluids.
research.RUWires.title: Wires
research.RUWires.description: Allows you to dynamically control your factories with wires.

island-layout.Layout_ShapeMiner.descript:
Extracts <gl>Shapes</gl> from <gl>Asteroids</gl>.

Connect up to 3 additional <gl>Extensions</gl> to increase the throughput.
island-layout.Layout_ShapeMinerExtension: Increases the throughput of a <gl>Shape Miner</gl>.
island-layout.Layout_FluidMiner.title: Fluid Miner
island-layout.Layout_FluidMiner.descript:

Connect up to 3 additional <gl>Extensions</gl> to increase the throughput.

Multiple <gl>Train Colors</gl> can share one rail.

island-layout.Layout_TrainLauncher.title: Train Launcher
island-layout.Layout_TrainLauncher.descr: <gl>Launches</gl> trains across <gl>Platforms</gl> or into the <gl>Vortex</gl> with variable range.
island-layout.Layout_TrainCatcher.title: Train Catcher
island-layout.Layout_RailPath_Red.title: Red Rail Configurator
island-layout.Layout_RailPath_Red.descri: Drag over a <gl>Rail Intersection</gl> to change which direction <gl>Red</gl> trains will take.
island-layout.Layout_RailPath_Blue.title: Blue Rail Configurator
island-layout.Layout_RailPath_Blue.descr: Drag over a <gl>Rail Intersection</gl> to change which direction <gl>Blue</gl> trains will take.
island-layout.Layout_RailPath_Green.desc: Drag over a <gl>Rail Intersection</gl> to change which direction <gl>Green</gl> trains will take.
island-layout.Layout_RailPath_White.desc: Drag over a <gl>Rail Intersection</gl> to change which direction <gl>White</gl> trains will take.
Accumulates <gl>Shapes</gl> into <gl>Fixed Size Packages</gl>, buffers them and loads them on <gl>Shape Wagons</gl>.
Accumulates <gl>Fluids</gl> into <gl>Fixed Size Packages</gl>, buffers them and loads them on <gl>Fluid Wagons</gl>.
island-layout.Layout_TrainStation.title: Train Stop
island-layout.Layout_TrainStation.descri: Signals trains to <gl>Stop</gl> so you can <gl>Load</gl> or <gl>Unload</gl> them.
island-layout.Layout_TrainShapeWagonExte: Place next to a <gl>Train Depot</gl> to add a <gl>Shape Wagon</gl> to the train.
island-layout.Layout_TrainFluidWagonExte: Place next to a <gl>Train Depot</gl> to add a <gl>Fluid Wagon</gl> to the train.
island-layout.Layout_TrainFillerWagonExt: Place next to a <gl>Train Depot</gl> to add a <gl>Filler Wagon</gl> to the train.
island-layout.Layout_TrainProducer_Red.d: Provides one <gl>Locomotive</gl>. Add <gl>Wagon Extensions</gl> to expand the train with wagons.
island-layout.Layout_TrainTwister.title: Rail Twister
island-layout.Layout_TrainTwister.descri:
Decorative only, makes trains <gl>Twist</gl> 360 degrees.

Part of the <gl>Train Roller Coaster</gl> Supporter Pack.
island-layout.Layout_TrainRollerCoasterL:
Decorative only, makes trains move in a <gl>Loop</gl>.

Part of the <gl>Train Roller Coaster</gl> Supporter Pack.
keybinding.main.toggle-research.descript: Open the last opened tab within the Research interface.
keybinding.main.toggle-research-levels.d: Open the milestone tab of the Research interface.
keybinding.main.toggle-research-shop.des: Open the shop tab of the Research interface.
keybinding.main.toggle-research-side-que: Open the tasks tab of the Research interface.
keybinding.main.toggle-pause.description: Pauses or resumes the game, this usually is not necessary, but we included it for convenience.
keybinding.main.toggle-ui.description: Toggles the interface, useful for creating screenshots.
keybinding.main.scope-change.description: Toggle between platform and building mode. This also automatically happens while zooming.
keybinding.main.undo.description: Undo your last operation, almost everything can be undone but there is a limit of 100 operations.
keybinding.main.redo.description: Redo an operation you previously used undo for.
keybinding.main.screenshot.description: Take a screenshot. The screenshot will be saved to your user folder.
keybinding.camera.rotate-cw.description: Rotate the Camera clockwise. The amount depends on your Camera Snapping setting.
keybinding.camera.rotate-ccw.description: Rotate the Camera counter-clockwise. The amount depends on your Camera Snapping setting.
keybinding.camera.move-right.description: Hold to move the camera to the right.
keybinding.camera.move-left.description: Hold to move the camera to the left.
keybinding.camera.move-up.description: Hold to move the camera to the top.
keybinding.camera.move-down.description: Hold to move the camera to the bottom.
keybinding.camera.move-faster.descriptio: Hold while using the 'Move left/right/up/down' buttons to move faster.
keybinding.camera.mouse-drag-modifier.de: Hold this key/button and drag to move the camera.
keybinding.camera.angle-drag-modifier.de: Hold and move the mouse to change the camera angle. Moving left/right changes the rotation, and up/down changes the angle.
keybinding.camera.select-layer-up.descri: Move one floor up. Use WHILE dragging Belts to place a Lift.
keybinding.camera.select-layer-down.desc: Move one floor down. Use WHILE dragging Belts to place a Lift.
keybinding.camera.toggle-show-all-layers: Toggles the visibility of structures <highlight>above</highlight> the current floor.
keybinding.camera.zoom-in.description: You can bind this a key to allow zooming the camera without a scroll wheel.
keybinding.camera.angle-up.description: You can bind this a key to allow changing the camera angle without using a middle mouse button.
keybinding.toolbar.next-toolbar.descript: Switch to the next toolbar category.
keybinding.toolbar.previous-toolbar.desc: Switch to the previous toolbar category.
keybinding.toolbar.next-variant.descript: Switch to the next unlocked variant during placement (i.e. to toggle between Rotator variants).
keybinding.toolbar.previous-variant.desc: Switch to the previous unlocked variant during placement (i.e. to toggle between Rotator variants).
Rotates the current structure clockwise by 90 degrees.
keybinding.building-placement.rotate-ccw: Rotates the current structure counter-clockwise by 90 degrees.
keybinding.building-placement.mirror.des: Flips or mirrors the current structure or blueprint.
keybinding.building-placement.mirror-inv: Flips or mirrors the current structure or blueprint on the other side.
keybinding.building-placement.switch-pat: While placing belts, use this hotkey to switch the corner a belt uses.
keybinding.building-placement.place-chec: Anchors a path, allowing you to drag it in any direction without changing anything before that point. Highly recommended to use since it makes placement much easier.
keybinding.building-placement.rotate-bui: Rotate a structure during placement so it faces to the right.
Rotate a structure during placement so it faces to the left.
Rotate a structure during placement so it faces to the top.
Rotate a structure during placement so it faces to the bottom.
keybinding.building-placement.transform-: Move the structure to a higher floor without changing the current floor. Useful for quickly moving blueprints or stackers.
Move the structure to a lower floor without changing the current floor. Useful for quickly moving blueprints or stackers.
keybinding.building-placement.blueprint-: Hold this modifier key during placement to override existing buildings.
keybinding.building-placement.save-bluep: Saves the selection as a Blueprint in your Blueprint Library.
keybinding.mass-selection.select-base.de: The base button for all selection commands. While holding & dragging, use either <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> or <hotkey:mass-selection.deselect-area-modifier/>.
keybinding.mass-selection.select-single-: Click/select individual structures to add or remove them to the selection.
keybinding.mass-selection.select-area-mo: Hold this modifier key and drag with <hotkey:mass-selection.select-base/> to select one or multiple structures.
keybinding.mass-selection.deselect-area-: Hold this modifier key and drag with <hotkey:mass-selection.select-base/> to reduce your current selection.
keybinding.mass-selection.delete.descrip: Destroys all structures in the current selection.
keybinding.mass-selection.select-all-of-: Hold this key while clicking a structure icon in the details panel of a selection to change the selection to include only this type of structure.
keybinding.mass-selection.quick-delete-d: Hold and drag to delete structures. You can hold <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> to delete an entire area.
keybinding.mass-selection.pipette.descri: Clone the structure below the mouse cursor so you can place more copies.
keybinding.mass-selection.make-blueprint: Create a placeable copy of the current selection.
keybinding.mass-selection.paste-blueprin: Paste a blueprint from the system clipboard.
keybinding.mass-selection.clear-selectio: Clears all items & fluids within the selected structures.
Cuts the current selection so it can be placed elsewhere.
keybinding.mass-selection.browse-bluepri: Hold this key while using your scroll wheel <hotkey:camera.angle-drag-modifier/> to browse through past blueprints.
keybinding.waypoints.create-new.descript: Create new Marker at the current camera position & orientation.
keybinding.waypoints.jump-back.descripti: After jumping to a Marker or the Vortex Platform, use this to jump back to your previous location.
keybinding.waypoints.center-on-base.desc: Jump back to your Vortex Platform.
keybinding.waypoints.edit-below-cursor.d: Hover a marker on the side and use this hotkey to edit it.
keybinding.debug.debug-console-autocompl: Try to auto-complete the current command input.
keybinding.debug.debug-console-select-pr: Go back to the previous command(s) issued.
keybinding.debug.debug-console-select-ne: Go forward to the next command(s) issued.
keybinding.debug.generic.description: Execute a command that was stored with 'console.bind-hotkey' previously.
keybinding.debug.fast-speed.description: For debugging purposes only. This is NOT a fast forward toggle and will cause your factories to run at less precision!
setting.resolution.description: The window resolution. Recommended to set to the same as your monitor resolution.
setting.music-volume.description: The volume of the music tracks.
setting.sfx-volume.description: The general volume of all sound effects.
setting.master-volume.description: The overall game volume, including music and sound effects.
setting.buildings-volume.description: Volume of the sounds from individual buildings, when zooming in close.
setting.ambience-volume.description: Volume of the space ambience or conveyor belt ambience.
setting.ui-volume.description: Volume of interface sound effects, i.e. buttons & notifications.
setting.mute-in-background.description: If enabled, the game will be muted while the window is not focused.
setting.tutorial.description: Highly recommended, enables the tutorial & general tips to succeed in the game.
setting.color-visualization-scheme.descr: Determines the color mixing scheme used by the game. This is purely visual and can be changed any time.
setting.antialiasing.description: Decreases artifacts at the edges of objects. MSAA is very performance intensive, and SMAA is very cheap. If you are playing on 4k, SMAA is highly recommended.
setting.ambient-occlusion.description: Increases the visual quality using screen space ambient occlusion. Can be very performance intensive on low-end setups.
setting.shadow-quality.description: Controls the resolution and quality of the shadows. Higher quality shadows require more GPU memory.
setting.shader-quality.description: Controls the shader quality & effects. On lower values, disables effects that are not relevant for gameplay.
setting.ui-scale.description: Controls the size of the user interface.
setting.copy-bp-to-clipboard.description: When enabled, automatically copies any selection to your system clipboard so you can share it with others or paste it again with <hotkey:mass-selection.paste-blueprint/> quickly.
setting.viewport-snapping.description: Snaps the camera while rotating to increments, i.e. with 90 degrees snapping the camera automatically snaps to either North, East, South or West.
setting.anisotropic-filtering.descriptio: Increases texture quality at steep angles, especially on the floor grid texture.
setting.vsync.description: Sync the maximum frame rate to your monitor refresh rate. Highly recommended. You can also sync it to half your refresh rate with '2nd VBlank' for example.
setting.fps-limit.description: Limits the maximum frames per second, but might introduce stuttering. Using VSync instead is highly recommended!
setting.window-mode.description: Fullscreen is the most performant and recommended option, but will cause a delay when switching back to your desktop.
setting.target-display.description: The target display for the game window to exist within.
setting.reduce-input-latency.description: Reduces input latency by preventing additional frames to be queued whilst the GPU is busy. This increases CPU load and can cause a lower framerate as a result.
setting.background-details.description: Controls the amount of details and decorations for the space background.
setting.island-details.description: Controls the details of the space platforms, lower values use less detailed meshes at the cost of visual quality.
setting.building-details.description: Controls the details of the buildings, lower values use less detailed meshes and animations at the cost of visual quality.
setting.autosave-interval.description: The game saves a backup of the savegame every once in a while. You can control the interval here.
setting.chromatic-aberration.description: Adds separation of color channels near the edges of the screen.
setting.vignette.description: Darkens the edges of the screen.
setting.post-processing.description: Enables color grading, vignette and outline. Very cheap, so disabling it is not recommended.
setting.interface-effects.description: Enables effects on the user interface. Very cheap, so disabling it is not recommended.
setting.savegame-backup-count.descriptio: The game automatically deletes old backups, but keeps a set of recent backups, as well as every 50th backup. Control here how many backups to keep at least.
Controls how fast the camera moves when you drag with the mouse to the left/right.
Controls how fast the camera moves when you drag with the mouse to the top/bottom.
setting.keyboard-camera-speed.descriptio: Controls how fast the camera moves when you move it with the keyboard.
setting.mouse-border-pan.description: If enabled, the camera automatically moves when you move your mouse cursor to the screen borders.
setting.mouse-border-pan-speed.descripti: Controls the speed of the screen panning.
setting.confine-mouse-cursor.description: If enabled, prevents your cursor from leaving the window while playing. Does not work on all platforms.
setting.invert-zoom.description: If enabled, inverts the direction the camera zooms when you use the scroll wheel.
setting.zoom-sensitivity.description: Controls how fast the camera zooms in/out when you use the scroll wheel.
setting.move-camera-with-layers.descript: By default, the camera also moves up and down when you switch a floor. You can disable it here to make the camera always stay at the same position.
setting.telemetry.description: Whether to send anonymized analytics to help improving the game.
setting.language.description: Please note that some languages are community translated, and the quality/completeness may differ depending on the language.
setting.menu-transitions.description: You can disable the menu animations if you experience motion sickness.
setting.show-keybinding-hints.descriptio: Whether to show recommended hotkeys on the bottom right of the screen.
setting.custom-cursor-type.description: Choose your preferred cursor here. Might require a restart to take effect.
setting.toolbar-duplicate-selection-mode: Choose what happens if you press a toolbar hotkey again. For example, you press '1' to select a conveyor belt. Now you press '1' again - with 'Deselect', the belt gets deselected, with 'Cycle Children' you now cycle to the belt launcher variant.
setting.simulation-mode.description: For internal testing only. Controls how the simulation is processed.
setting.editor-start-in-mode.description: For internal testing only. Controls what mode the editor starts when there is no existing savegame.
setting.unlock-dlcs.description: For internal testing only. Whether to pretend all DLCs are unlocked.
setting.start-fresh-in-editor.descriptio: For internal testing only. Whether to always start a fresh savegame in the editor, even if there is a savegame already.
setting.test-tutorial-hints.description: For internal testing only. Shows tutorial hints much more quickly, and also shows hidden tutorial steps in the knowledge panel.

wiki.WKWelcome.title: Welcome to your Qualification!
wiki.WKWelcome.text-intro-1:
Thank you for signing up! You did sign up, right ..?

Either way .. the <gl>Vortex</gl> requires us to evaluate your <gl>Factory Operator</gl> skills before issuing your <gl>Operators Certificate</gl>. 

Simply deliver the requested <gl>Shapes</gl> as efficient as possible. That's it!

We might reward you with new <gl>Upgrades</gl> and <gl>Technologies</gl> based on your performance..
wiki.WKWelcome.text-intro-3: Ah, and you can have as many <gl>Buildings</gl> as you want. But please don't damage them - we still need them for the next participant.
wiki.WKShapes.title: Shapes
wiki.WKShapes.text-shapes-1: <gl>Shapes</gl> are composed of smaller sections, named <gl>Quarters</gl>, that can be separated and reorganized.
wiki.WKShapes.text-shapes-2: Similar to cakes, shapes can have multiple <gl>Layers</gl>, each with up to 4 distinct quarters. Different types of quarters can be found by expanding deeper into space.
wiki.WKShapes.text-shape-viewer-1: You can inspect shapes in the <gl>Shape Viewer</gl> by clicking <hotkey:building-placement.confirm-placement/> any shape in the <gl>User Interface</gl>.
wiki.WKCameraControls.title: Camera Navigation
wiki.WKCameraControls.text-camera-move: Use <hotkey:camera.move-up/>, <hotkey:camera.move-left/>, <hotkey:camera.move-down/>, <hotkey:camera.move-right/> to move the camera. You can also use <hotkey:camera.mouse-drag-modifier/>, but it does not work during placement.
wiki.WKCameraControls.text-camera-rotate: To change the <gl>Rotation</gl> and <gl>Angle</gl>, hold <hotkey:camera.angle-drag-modifier/> and move the mouse horizontally to change the direction, and vertically to change the perspective.
wiki.WKCameraControls.text-camera-snap-1: The camera automatically <gl>Snaps</gl> to multiples of 30 degrees by default. You can change this by clicking the magnet icon in the bottom left corner of the screen.
wiki.WKCameraControls.text-camera-snap-2: For example, with 90 degrees snapping the camera automatically snaps to either North, East, South or West.
wiki.WKCameraControls.text-jumpvortex-1: If you ever get lost, you can click the Home Icon or press to jump back to the Vortex Platform.
wiki.WKBasicControls.title: Basic Controls
wiki.WKBasicControls.text-placement-2: You can <gl>Rotate</gl> any structure with <hotkey:building-placement.rotate-cw/> and <hotkey:building-placement.rotate-ccw/>.
wiki.WKBasicControls.text-deletion-2: To delete an entire <gl>Area</gl>, drag with <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> + <hotkey:mass-selection.quick-delete-drag/>.
wiki.WKBasicControls.text-pipette-1: Move the cursor over a structure and press <hotkey:mass-selection.pipette/> to quickly select it in the toolbar.
wiki.WKBasicControls.text-mirroring-1: Buildings, Platforms and Blueprints can be <gl>Mirrored</gl> with <hotkey:building-placement.mirror/>. Use <hotkey:building-placement.mirror-inverse/> to mirror on the other axis.
wiki.WKBasicControls.text-floor-visibili: Press <hotkey:camera.toggle-show-all-layers/> to toggle the <gl>Visibility</gl> of higher <gl>Floors</gl>.
wiki.WKBasicControls.text-undoredo-1: You can <gl>Undo</gl> your actions with <hotkey:main.undo/> and <gl>Redo</gl> it with <hotkey:main.redo/>.
wiki.WKBasicControls.text-toolbar-1: Use the <gl>Toolbar Shortcuts</gl> to quickly select slots on the toolbar.
wiki.WKBasicControls.text-toolbar-2: Use <hotkey:toolbar.next-variant/> to switch between different <gl>Building Variants</gl>.
wiki.WKBasicControls.text-toolbar-3: You can also press <hotkey:toolbar.next-toolbar/> to switch to the next category.
wiki.WKBeltPlacement.title: Belt Placement
wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-placement-1: Select a belt and drag with <hotkey:building-placement.confirm-placement/> to place it.
wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-anchors-1: Place an <gl>Anchor</gl> with <hotkey:building-placement.place-checkpoint/>. They are extremely useful to quickly place even the most complex belts.
wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-splitters-1: Drag from existing belts to automatically <gl>Split</gl> them, and onto existing belts to <gl>Merge</gl> them.
wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-cross-floor-1: Once you unlocked the second <gl>Floor</gl>, you can transport items between floors and even place buildings there.
wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-cross-floor-2: While dragging, press to move one layer up and press to move one layer down. This will automatically place a Conveyor Lift.
wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-ideal-ratios-1: You need <gl>Multiple Buildings</gl> per belt. The <gl>Ideal Ratio</gl> between belts and a specific building is shown in the <gl>Details Panel</gl> during placement (<gl>Buildings Per Full Belt</gl>) and depends on your upgrade levels in the <gl>Shop</gl>.
wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-flip-edge1: For more refined control, you can press <hotkey:building-placement.mirror/> to <gl>Flip</gl> the edge of the belt.
wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-rotation-1: During placement, belts automatically adjust their rotation to match surrounding buildings. However, you can enforce a <gl>Manual Rotation</gl>, both for the start and end.
wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-rotation-2: Press <hotkey:building-placement.rotate-cw/> before the placement to set a <gl>Manual Starting Rotation</gl>, and during the placement to set a <gl>Manual End Rotation</gl>.
wiki.WKResearch.title: Research
wiki.WKResearch.text-intro-1: Complete <gl>Research Goals</gl> by delivering the <gl>Shapes</gl> demanded by the <gl>Vortex</gl>.
wiki.WKResearch.text-intro-2: You can open the Research Interface with or by using the buttons in the top left. You can also bind custom hotkeys for every tab in the settings.
wiki.WKResearch.text-milestones-1: <gl>Milestones</gl> are huge goals, and once completed the <gl>Vortex</gl> will reward your efforts with entirely new technologies.
wiki.WKResearch.text-milestones-2: Try to focus on advancing towards the next Milestone before starting new side tasks to avoid waiting times.
wiki.WKResearch.text-side-tasks-2: While you wait for the current Milestone to complete, you can start <gl>Side Tasks</gl>. These are smaller goals that evolve in multiple steps, and you will be granted <gl>Research Points</gl> upon completion.
wiki.WKResearch.text-task-pins: You can <gl>Pin</gl> a task to keep track of your progress.
wiki.WKResearch.text-shop-1: Once you accumulated <gl>Research Points</gl>, visit the <gl>Shop</gl> to acquire upgrades and enhance your factory.
wiki.WKResearch.text-shop-2: Upgrades can be very powerful, so be sure to keep an eye out for new ones and choose wisely!
wiki.WKExpanding.title: Scaling Up
wiki.WKExpanding.text-intro: To keep up with the demands of the <gl>Vortex</gl>, expanding your factory is required. Successful operators have agreed on a set of best practices, and we convinced them to share those with you.
wiki.WKExpanding.text-modularity-1: Try to group parts of your factory into <gl>Modules</gl> that can be reused and exchanged.
wiki.WKExpanding.text-modularity-2: Reuse those parts utilizing <link:wiki.WKBlueprints>Blueprints</link> so you don't have to constantly build them from scratch.
wiki.WKExpanding.text-platform-modules-1: If you think of platforms as buildings, you can apply the concepts you learned on a new scale.
wiki.WKExpanding.text-platform-modules-2: Why not build a platform that takes 4 belts of shapes, rotates all of them and outputs them on the other side?
wiki.WKExpanding.text-platform-modules-3: Voila - you now have your own <gl>Space Rotator Module</gl>!
wiki.WKCutting.title: Cutting Shapes
wiki.WKCutting.text-intro: The <gl>Quarters</gl> that make up a <gl>Shape</gl> can be separated and altered. Buildings of the <gl>Cutting</gl> type will assist you in isolating, separating or swapping shapes.
wiki.WKCutting.text-destroyer: The Half-Destroyer uses the isolator laser to disintegrate the West Half of a shape, outputting anything that remains.
wiki.WKCutting.text-cutter: Once unlocked in the shop, the Cutter utilizes a holographic blade to split a Shape in two, separating its West Half and outputting it in parallel.
wiki.WKCutting.text-swapper: Once unlocked in the shop, the Swapper utilizes two holo-blades, allowing it to simultaneously split shapes and swap their West Halves, before outputting both.
wiki.WKRotating.title: Rotating Shapes
wiki.WKRotating.text-intro: With rotators you can change the <gl>Rotation</gl> of shapes.
wiki.WKRotating.text-rotator-1: The regular Rotator rotates your shape by 90 degrees clockwise, allowing for all four rotations to be achieved.
wiki.WKRotating.text-rotator-2: Additional variants can be purchased in the <gl>Shop</gl> for rotating counter-clockwise or by 180 degrees, enabling more elegant builds.
wiki.WKRotating.text-vortex: The Vortex accepts any shape rotation, so there is no need to rotate the shapes before.
wiki.WKRotating.text-building-rotation-1: While it does not matter for the vortex, the rotation of shapes when entering a <gl>Building</gl> affects how they are processed, as you will see in the examples below.
wiki.WKRotating.text-cutting: All Cutters separate the West Half of a shape. By rotating a Shape, you can control which half is cut. This allows you to cut, rotate and cut again to produce Quarters for example.
wiki.WKRotating.text-stacking: Shapes are <link:wiki.WKStacking>Stacked</link> as if they fell on top of each other. By rotating a shape, you can control which part falls where. This is what allows two halves to become a whole shape or end up on top of one another.
wiki.WKStacking.title: Stacking Shapes
wiki.WKStacking.text-intro: Shapes can be combined through <gl>Stacking</gl>, which enables the production of shapes with multiple <gl>Layers</gl> and/or to combine different <gl>Quarters</gl> into a single layer.
wiki.WKStacking.text-stacker-1: The <gl>Stacker</gl> receives shapes from two floors - as the upper shape is dropped on top of the lower, any disconnected sections will fall until they hit a solid surface.
wiki.WKStacking.text-stacker-2: If both shapes are whole, they'll end up on top of each other - for shapes full of empty or loose quarters, some parts can fall further before landing.
wiki.WKStacking.text-layer-limit-1: Shapes can have 4 layers at most. Attempting to stack more than 4 layers will cause the excess layers to be discarded.
wiki.WKStacking.text-layer-limit-2: Without spoiling too much, you can use this for specific mechanics in the later stages of the game, so it is worth to keep in mind!
wiki.WKBlueprints.title: Blueprints
wiki.WKBlueprints.text-intro-1: <gl>Blueprints</gl> allow you to quickly copy and paste sections of your factories, avoiding repetitive work.
wiki.WKBlueprints.text-copypaste-1: Select an area with <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> <hotkey:mass-selection.select-base/>, then press <hotkey:mass-selection.make-blueprint/> to copy it.
wiki.WKBlueprints.text-copypaste-2: Blueprints are copied as <gl>Blueprint Code</gl> to your system clipboard by default, so you can share them with others!
wiki.WKBlueprints.text-library-1: Any blueprint or selection can be saved to the <gl>Blueprint Library</gl> with <hotkey:building-placement.save-blueprint/>.
wiki.WKBlueprints.text-library-2: The library can be accessed with <hotkey:main.toggle-blueprint-library/> or its designated button at the top-right of the screen.
wiki.WKBlueprints.text-library-3: Saved blueprints can be edited with right click.
wiki.WKBlueprints.text-toolbar-1: Any blueprint can be placed in the <gl>Blueprint Toolbar</gl>.
wiki.WKBlueprints.text-cost-1: Blueprints are free on normal difficulty. On challenge difficulty, you need to deliver specific shapes to generate Blueprint Points first.
wiki.WKPlatforms.title: Space Platforms
wiki.WKPlatforms.text-intro-1: Unlocking <gl>Space Platforms</gl> allows you to expand your factories beyond the <gl>Vortex Platform</gl>.
wiki.WKPlatforms.text-intro-2: Regular layouts serve as foundations for <gl>Buildings</gl>; unique layouts, like <gl>Miners</gl>, have a specific purpose.
wiki.WKPlatforms.text-chunk-limit-1: Placing platforms consumes your <gl>Platform Limit</gl>, which you can increase by completing <gl>Side Tasks</gl>.
wiki.WKPlatforms.text-chunk-limit-2: The limit is refunded when the platform is deleted.
wiki.WKPlatforms.text-platform-scope-1: Zoom out or press <hotkey:main.scope-change/> to switch between <gl>Building Mode</gl> and <gl>Platform Mode</gl>.
wiki.WKPlatforms.text-belt-1: <gl>Space Belts</gl> can be placed just as regular belts but on platform scale. They transport up to 4 belts per floor, up to a maximum of 12.
wiki.WKPlatforms.text-belt-tunnels: You can use <gl>Space Belt Tunnels</gl> to route belts below other platforms, belts or rails.
wiki.WKPlatforms.text-miner-1: <gl>Miner Platforms</gl> can only be placed on top of <gl>Asteroids</gl> - once placed, the resource can be obtained by placing the appropriate extractors on the platform.
wiki.WKPlatforms.text-miner-extension-1: You can chain up to 3 <gl>Miner Extensions</gl> to increase the throughput.
wiki.WKPlatforms.text-layout: To create <link:wiki.WKExpanding>Platform Modules</link> or simply expand your buildable area, platforms serve as <gl>Foundations</gl> for your structures. Additional layouts can be unlocked in the <gl>Shop</gl>.
wiki.WKPinPusher.title: Pin Pusher
wiki.WKPinPusher.text-intro: Shape quarters that are not connected will fall when <link:wiki.WKStacking>Stacked</link>. However, with <gl>Support Pins</gl> you can build shapes that are impossible to build otherwise.
wiki.WKPinPusher.text-pusher-1: The Pin Pusher pushes a Support Pin under every non-empty Quadrant on the first layer. These pins hold the quarters and can be stacked themselves.
wiki.WKPinPusher.text-pusher-2: Utilizing this technology, you can create shapes that would otherwise be impossible - with large gaps and sections elevated by multiple layers.
wiki.WKPinPusher.text-layer-limit-1: Attempting to push a shape over 4 layers will cause the excess layers to be discarded.
wiki.WKPinPusher.text-layer-limit-2: You can use this to create shapes with pins on top.
wiki.WKTrains.title: Trains
wiki.WKTrains.text-intro: With <gl>Trains</gl> you can transport huge amounts of shapes and fluids over long distances.
wiki.WKTrains.text-rails-1: Trains can only go on <gl>Rails</gl>. Place them just like you would place regular belts or space belts.
wiki.WKTrains.text-rails-2: Once trains reach the end of a rail, they will go back on the <gl>Bottom Side</gl>, following the same path they took on the top side.
wiki.WKTrains.text-depots-1: Every train is owned by a <gl>Train Depot</gl>. When placing the depot, you can select which color the train will have - more colors can be unlocked in the <gl>Shop</gl>.
wiki.WKTrains.text-depots-2: Place one or multiple <gl>Wagon Extensions</gl> behind the depot to determine the layout of the train.
wiki.WKTrains.text-loading-1: Trains only stop if they reach a <gl>Train Stop</gl>. Placing stops is required to load and unload trains.
wiki.WKTrains.text-loading-2: To load a train, place one or multiple <gl>Train Shape Loaders</gl> behind a train stop and connect it to your factory.
wiki.WKTrains.text-loading-3: To unload a train, do the same but with <gl>Train Shape Unloaders</gl>.
wiki.WKTrains.text-routing-1: Trains drive forward, unless otherwise specified. You can use <gl>Rail Routing</gl> to make different colored trains go into different directions.
wiki.WKTrains.text-routing-2: For example, you can make red trains skip a certain stop:
wiki.WKTrains.text-launchers-1: Just like belts, you can also launch trains to cross gaps using <gl>Train Launchers</gl>. You can adjust the range with the scroll wheel <hotkey:camera.angle-drag-modifier/>.
wiki.WKTrains.text-launchers-2: Trains can also be launched directly into the <gl>Vortex Platform</gl>, counting as delivery to the vortex.
wiki.WKFluids.title: Fluids & Painting
wiki.WKFluids.text-intro: <gl>Color Fluids</gl> are required to paint shapes, introducing multiple new concepts.
wiki.WKFluids.text-fluid-miner-1: Use <gl>Fluid Miners</gl> similar to shape miners to extract <gl>Fluid Deposits</gl> on the map.
wiki.WKFluids.text-fluid-miner-2: You can unlock a <gl>Fluid Miner Extension</gl> in the shop to increase the throughput:
wiki.WKFluids.text-pumps-1: Place one or multiple <gl>Pumps</gl> on the Fluid Miner. Every pump extracts a fixed amount of liters per minute, which you can view by clicking the pump.
wiki.WKFluids.text-pipes-1: <gl>Pipes</gl> are required to transport fluids. While the are placed similar to belts, they have almost no throughput limit.
wiki.WKFluids.text-space-pipes-1: Use <gl>Space Pipes</gl> to transport fluids between platforms - they can't go on regular space belts.
wiki.WKFluids.text-space-pipes-2: <gl>Space Pipe Tunnels</gl> are also available and work exactly as the space belt tunnels.
wiki.WKFluids.text-painter-1: Connect both fluid and shapes to a Painter to paint the shape. The painter always paints the Topmost layer of a given shape.
wiki.WKFluids.text-color-blind-1: If you have trouble distinguishing the colors below (every pipe contains a different color), you might be <gl>Color Blind</gl>.
wiki.WKFluids.text-color-blind-2: You can switch the color scheme to RGB (Color blind) in the settings to be able to distinguish the colors.
wiki.WKMixing.title: Color Mixing
wiki.WKMixing.text-intro: By <gl>Mixing Colors</gl> you can create <gl>Secondary</gl> and <gl>Tertiary</gl> colors.
wiki.WKMixing.text-mixer-1: Use the <gl>Color Mixer</gl> and connect two <gl>Color Fluids</gl> to mix them.
wiki.WKMixing.text-mixer-2: The <gl>Fluid Volume</gl> is preserved, so if you mix 10 liters of red and 10 liters of green, you get 20 liters of yellow.
wiki.WKMixing.text-mixing-scheme-1: By default, colors are mixed using <gl>Additive Color Mixing</gl>, similar to light.
wiki.WKMixing.text-mixing-scheme-2: If you prefer alternative schemes like RYB or CMYK, you can change the <gl>Color Mixing Scheme</gl> in the settings any time.
wiki.WKCrystals.title: Crystals
wiki.WKCrystals.text-intro: <gl>Crystals</gl> are produced by hardening fluids and are designed by the vortex to challenge even the most experienced operators.
wiki.WKCrystals.text-crystal-generation: The <gl>Crystal Generator</gl> fills <gl>Gaps</gl> and <gl>Pins</gl> in a shape with the provided fluid, hardening the fluid to <gl>Crystal</gl> in the process.
wiki.WKCrystals.text-crystal-behaviour-1: Crystals are <gl>Fragile</gl>, and thus break when falling down, for example while <link:wiki.WKStacking>Stacked</link>.
wiki.WKCrystals.text-crystal-behaviour-2: <link:wiki.WKCutting>Cutting</link> through a crystal will <gl>Shatter</gl> it, destroying all connected crystals on the same, upper and lower shape layers.
tutorial.skip-tutorial-button.title: Mark Completed
tutorial.side-goal-before-milestone-warn: We recommend prioritizing the milestone shapes first, and doing the side tasks while they are being delivered!
tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_JumpToHUB: Lost? Click the <gl>Home Icon</gl> or press <hotkey:waypoints.center-on-base/> to jump back to the <gl>Vortex Platform</gl>.
tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_ShapeViewer: Click any shape in the interface to open the <gl>Shape Viewer</gl>.
tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_Predictions: <gl>Shape Previews</gl> show you the result even before shapes arrive, allowing you to build faster.
tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_FloorVisibility: Press <hotkey:camera.toggle-show-all-layers/> to toggle the <gl>Visibility</gl> of higher <gl>Floors</gl>.
tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_Mirroring: Buildings, Platforms and Blueprints can be <gl>Mirrored</gl> with <hotkey:building-placement.mirror/>. Use <hotkey:building-placement.mirror-inverse/> to mirror on the other axis.
tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_MultiLayerHubDel: You can deliver shapes on <gl>Multiple Floors</gl> to the <gl>Vortex</gl>. If that still is not sufficient, you can increase the <gl>Vortex Inputs</gl> in the shop.
tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_Pipette: Move your cursor over a building or platform and press <hotkey:mass-selection.pipette/> to quickly select it in the toolbar.
tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_SaveBlueprintToL: Press <hotkey:building-placement.save-blueprint/> to <gl>Save</gl> a selection or blueprint to your <gl>Library</gl>, allowing you to quickly access it later.
tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_BindBlueprintToT: You can assign blueprints and blueprint folders to the <gl>Blueprint Toolbar</gl> for quick access.
tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_Visualizations: Toggle <gl>Visualizations</gl> while in <gl>Platform mode</gl> to customize your view.
tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_SelectConnectedB: Press <hotkey:mass-selection.select-connected/> to <gl>Expand</gl> a selection to all <gl>Connected Structures</gl>.
tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_ClearSelectionCo: Press <hotkey:mass-selection.clear-selection-contents/> to <gl>Clear</gl> all shapes and fluids of a <gl>Selection</gl>.
tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_PasteBlueprint: Press <hotkey:mass-selection.paste-blueprint/> to re-select your most recent blueprint.
tutorial.TSFirstLevel_1_PlaceBelts: Use <gl>Belts</gl> to deliver the shapes to the <gl>Vortex</gl> on the right.
tutorial.TSFirstLevel_2_1_WaitDeliveryWi: Open the <gl>Knowledge Panel</gl> to view previous instructions!
tutorial.TSFirstLevel_2_2_WaitDelivery: Your goal is always shown below. Deliver the requested circles.
tutorial.TSFirstLevel_3_HalfCutter: Place 3 Half Destroyers to cut shapes into halves. ( / 3).
tutorial.TSFirstLevel_3_HalfCutter_Skill: You need <gl>Multiple Buildings</gl> per belt, the <gl>Amount</gl> is shown <gl>Top Right</gl>.
tutorial.TSFirstLevel_4_2_DeliverHalfCir:
Deliver the half circles.

This is not an idle game - why not extract some <gl>Squares</gl> already?
tutorial.TSFirstLevel_4_3_DeliverHalfCir:
Well done!

Deliver the remaining half circles and squares.
tutorial.TSFirstLevel_5_DeliverQuarterCi: Cut, Rotate and Cut again to produce quarter circles!
tutorial.TSFirstLevel_5_CutRotateCut_Ski: Place a Rotator between half destroyers to produce Quarters.
tutorial.TSStacker_0_PlaceStacker: Let's combine circles and squares! Place 4 Stackers ( / 4).
tutorial.TSStacker_0_PlaceStacker_Skill: Stackers output to the side, so you need a Gap between.
tutorial.TSStacker_StackedWrongOrder_Ski: Oops! Connect the stackers in the right order, it matters which belt goes on the top and which on the bottom.
tutorial.TSStacker_1_ConnectStackers: Supply the stackers with circles and squares!
tutorial.TSStacker_1_ConnectStackersLaye: Build a <gl>Conveyor Lift</gl> by pressing <hotkey:camera.select-layer-up/> / <hotkey:camera.select-layer-down/> during placement.
tutorial.TSStacker_2_DeliverStackerResul:
Well done!

Now deliver the stacked shapes to the vortex.
tutorial.TSStacker_3_OpenResearchSideTas: <gl>Research Points</gl> are rewarded for completing <gl>Side Tasks</gl>. Open the overview.
tutorial.TSStacker_3_PinSideTask_Skill: <gl>Pin</gl> the tasks you want to work on, making them always visible.
tutorial.TSStacker_4_SpendResearchPoints: Use the points to purchase an item from the <gl>Shop</gl>.
tutorial.TSStacker_4_OpenResearchShop_Sk: Open the <gl>Shop</gl>, where you can buy <gl>Upgrades</gl> using research points.
tutorial.TSBlueprints_0_CreateBlueprint_: Select an <gl>Area</gl> with <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> <hotkey:mass-selection.select-base/> and then press <hotkey:mass-selection.make-blueprint/> to <gl>Copy</gl> it.
tutorial.TSIslands_0_PlaceShapeMiner:
Place a <gl>Shape Miner</gl> to extract shapes.

You can also chain <gl>Extensions</gl> to increase the throughput.
tutorial.TSIslands_1_ConnectMinerSpaceBe: Use <gl>Space Belts</gl> to connect the miner to the vortex.
tutorial.TSIslands_EnterIslandMode_Skill: Zoom out with <hotkey:camera.angle-drag-modifier/> or press <hotkey:main.scope-change/> to enter <gl>Platform Mode</gl>.
tutorial.TSIslands_SpaceBelt_Skill: <gl>Space Belts</gl> work just like regular belts, except on much bigger scale.
tutorial.TSIslands_SpaceBeltTunnels_Skil: You can place <gl>Tunnels</gl> to route space belts below other platforms.
tutorial.TSIslands_ShapeMinerExtension_S: Connect up to 3 <gl>Shape Miner Extensions</gl> to the <gl>Shape Miner</gl> to activate all extraction spots.
tutorial.TSIslands_LowChunkLimit_Skill: Placing platforms costs <gl>Platform Units</gl> which can be gained from side tasks and are refunded on deletion.
tutorial.TSIslands_DeleteIslandUndoRedo_: You can <gl>Undo</gl> any operation with <hotkey:main.undo/> and <gl>Redo</gl> it with <hotkey:main.redo/>.
tutorial.TSTrains_1_PlaceTrainDepot: Place a <gl>Train Depot</gl> to setup your train.
tutorial.TSTrains_2_PlaceShapeWagon:
Place one or multiple <gl>Wagon Extensions</gl> behind the depot.

Each extensions adds a <gl>wagon</gl> to the train.
tutorial.TSTrains_3_PlaceTrainLoaderAndS:
Now place a <gl>Train Stop</gl>, which is required to make the train halt.

Also, place at least one <gl>Train Shape Loader</gl> behind the stop.
tutorial.TSTrains_4_PlaceTrainUnloader: Great job! Now place another <gl>Train Stop</gl> including a <gl>Train Shape Unloader</gl> to unload the train.
tutorial.TSTrains_Routing_Skill: You can <gl>Route</gl> different train <gl>Colors</gl> in different directions.
tutorial.TSTrains_DepotsAndWagons_Skill: Place a <gl>Train Depot</gl> and then one or multiple <gl>Wagon Extensions</gl> to setup your train.
tutorial.TSTrains_StopsAndLoaders_Skill: Place a <gl>Train Stop</gl> and then one or multiple <gl>Loaders</gl> or <gl>Unloaders</gl> to exchange items with the train.
tutorial.TSTrains_Launchers_Skill: You can launch trains with Launchers to cross other platforms. Use the scroll wheel to adjust the distance.
tutorial.TSFluids_0_PlaceFluidMiner: Place a <gl>Fluid Miner</gl> to extract fluids.
tutorial.TSFluids_2_PlacePipe: Connect the pump with a <gl>Pipe</gl> to the output of the platform.
tutorial.TSFluids_3_PlaceSpacePipe: Use a <gl>Space Pipe</gl> to transport the fluids to the platform where you want to paint the shapes.
tutorial.TSFluids_4_Painter: Place a <gl>Painter</gl> and paint your first shape!
tutorial.TSFluids_FluidMinerExtension_Sk: Connect up to 3 <gl>Fluid Miner Extensions</gl> to the fluid miner to activate all extraction spots.
tutorial.TSFluids_SpacePipe_Skill: <gl>Space Pipes</gl> can transport fluids in high amounts.
